results.title: Pretty woman (Director's cut)
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Silver Screen Partners IV, Arnon Milchan, Steven Reuther and Garry Marshall
results.brief_description: Directed by Garry Marshall “Pretty woman” was the film that helped make a star of American actress Julia Roberts. Originally conceived as a film with a much darker tone, “Pretty woman” is a fairly light-hearted comedy. Edward Lewis, (Richard Gere) a businessman whose speciality is company takeovers, is on assignment in LA when he picks up a prostitute, Viv (Roberts), for the night. In the morning Lewis decides he likes what he sees and decides to hire Viv for a week’s round of polo parties and sex. Despite being somewhat gauche in her dress and manner, Viv is groomed for the part of the society lady, in a Pygmalion like transformation. Challenges ensue for the couple as they take a liking to one another beyond the bounds of their business arrangement. Each is drawn to the possibility that at the week’s end their partnership may blossom into a relationship. Also stars Laura San Giacomo as Viv’s housemate (also a prostitute) and Jason Alexander who plays Lewis’ sleazy lawyer. This special edition version of “Pretty woman” is the director’s cut.

results.title: Pretty village pretty flame = Lepa sela lepo gore
results.creator_credit: Goran Bjelogrlic, Cobra Film Development and Srdjan Dragojevic
results.brief_description: Set in the early days of the Bosnian War, this film is based around the relationship of two young men who find themselves on opposing sides in the conflict. Holed up in a tunnel, the Serbian soldiers strive to maintain their bawdy sense of humour while under siege from Muslim soldiers who are torturing and killing those around them. The continuing problem of accountability is highlighted, as soldiers on each side deny responsibility for the atrocities which have affected the other. Meanwhile, their country is torn apart. A powerful anti-war film that conveys the futility of war through the often ironic use of popular music, including a rendition of John Lennon’s “Give peace a chance”. In Serbian with English subtitles.

results.title: Pretty stupid
results.brief_description: Young Australian girls are under constant pressure to gain “the perfect body image”. This usually means to be thin, and conforming to a body shape that is notionally linked to a successful, fun and sexy lifestyle. For most young women, trying to achieve an unrealistically thin body can lead to endless dieting, excessive exercise, depression and sometimes fatal eating disorders. Often the culprit is seen as the fashion industry’s cult of slenderness with “heroin chic” and waif-like models. This documentary explores this issue with the editors of women’s magazines Cleo, Cosmopolitan and Dolly, including an interview with Pia Loyola, fourteen year old Dolly/Impulse 1998 cover girl competition winner. Other interviews are with a dietician and a model management agency. This interesting and topical program looks at the issue of the ideal female body, how the fashion industry, advertisers and women’s magazines determine their views on female beauty and ideal body shape, and the new responsibility women’s magazine editors have in educating their readership about the uniqueness of individual bodies.

results.title: Pretty in pink
results.creator_credit: Lauren Shuler, Paramount Pictures and Howard Deutch
results.brief_description: Andie (Molly Ringwald) is a girl of modest means, who may have to suffer the humiliation of having no date for the prom. She just wants to express herself through her eccentric fashion sense, but this does not sit well with her peers at the snob-ridden local high school. Pretty in Pink’ is a classic80s “teen flick”, which, to quote Adrian Martin, “sensitizes us to all that is modest, fleeting, fragile in popular cinema and popular culture”. Cast includes Molly Ringwald, Andrew McCarthy and Jon Cryer.

results.title: Pretty as a picture: the art of David Lynch
results.creator_credit: Toby Keeler and Fine Cut Presentations
results.brief_description: Using a behind the scenes look at the production of David Lynch’s ‘Lost highway’, this documentary looks at the auteur who brought us ‘Eraserhead’ (307091), ‘Elephant man’ (302534), ‘Blue velvet (302912), and the television series ‘Twin peaks’. He discusses his inspiration, impressions of his first film, and his drive for creative expression. Interviews are presented with actors who have starred in Lynchs’ films, relatives, and production crew. They include; Bill Pullman, Patricia Arquette, Mel Brooks, Jack Frisk, Barry Gifford, Jennifer Lynch, Jack Nance, Mary Sweeney and Dean Stockwell.

results.title: Pretend you're wearing a barrel
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Shelah Reljic, John Taylor and Jan-Marie Martell
results.brief_description: At thirty-five, Lynn Ryan took stock of her life. She had five children, no husband, no job, and the outlook for getting off welfare seemed bleak. That was when she decided to change her life. After help from employment counsellors and a course in welding, she now has a good job as an apprentice engineer in a Vancouver shipyard. This is a vivid picture of a tough-minded woman and her courageous encounter with life.

results.title: Pret-a-porter = Ready to wear
results.brief_description:
Every year in Paris, the top designers and supermodels stage the world’s hottest fashion show. It is called “Pret-a-Porter” and it means “Ready to Wear”. Only this time, there has been a murder and everyone is a suspect. Once again Altman gathers a remarkable ensemble cast of stars and celebrities to weave an elaborate interlocking web of stories and events. High fashion is subjected to the critical glare and ironic wit typical of Altman’s films, in this tangled tale of sex and sin, designed to seduce and dressed to kill.
Cast includes: Marcello Mastroianni, Sophia Loren, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Kim Basinger, Anouk Aimee, Rupert Everett, Lili Taylor, Forest Whitaker, Richard E. Grant, Julia Roberts, Tim Robbins, Lauren Bacall, Lyle Lovett, Tracey Ullman, Sally Kellerman, Teri Garr, Danny Aiello, Harry Belafonte, Cher, and an array of famous designers and models appearing as themselves.

results.title: Presumed innocent
results.creator_credit: Mirage Enterprises, Sydney Pollack, Mark Rosenberg and Alan Pakula
results.brief_description: This courtroom drama based on the Scott Turow novel of the same name contains murder, sex and intrigue. It stars Harrison Ford as the prosecutor, Rusty Sabich, who is asked to investigate the murder of a colleague. He is reluctant to do so because he has had a previous affair with her. What follows is a twisted tale of suspense and surprise. Supporting cast includes Brian Dennehy, Raul Julia, Bonnie Bedelia, Paul Winfield and Greta Scacchi. Music by John Williams.

results.title: Presumed guilty
results.creator_credit: Vanson Wardle, Michael Mansfield and Yvette Watson
results.brief_description: Presumed guilty compares elements of the French, American and British legal systems to construct an alternative that reaffirms the fundamental right that a person is presumed innocent until proven guilty. Top defence barrister Michael Mansfield QC reveals his agenda for change in the British/Australian system of criminal justice, exposing the brutalities and iniquities of a system once thought to be the most just in the world.
